results.title: Mid-level Software Developer
results.description:
We are SICCAR, and we’re building a product to better connect and protect businesses and society.

 

SICCAR is a blockchain-based enterprise data sharing platform that gives organisations full control over how data is shared and used across their business ecosystem. Our transformative technology is being applied to enable trust, resilience and security in high impact problems, sustainability, government and business.

 

The platform is a .Net Microservices-based decentralised shared data protection system, based on our refined Blockchain solution which has been derived from Bitcoin cryptography and concepts. Through the use of our SDKs, the platform is easily used by our partners and solution providers to build scenario-specific applications for interaction and sharing of data across multiple organisations in a controlled, verifiable, and provable manner.

 

We’re a team of innovative people of purpose, who want to change the world and have fun doing it – now seeking software professionals to join our small engineering team as we innovate and refine our platform to deliver on an exciting future roadmap. We use Azure DevOps to execute and build on our development programme in an Agile-based Sprint methodology.

 

You will bring experience and expertise that will complement our current tech stack. Have a problem solving, can do, attitude and you’re not afraid to speak your mind.  You will take stories where you can apply your expertise in areas from enhancing underlying platform engineering, through to developing innovative technology features and customer specific deliverables. You will be learning and working with experts in exciting cryptographic and decentralised data technologies.

 

What we are looking for:

  • 2+ years professional experience in C# .Net (.Net 6 preferred)
  • Experience writing ASP.Net based API Services
  • Experience with Visual Studio, Git and preferably Azure Devops
  • Knowledge and interest in Blockchain/DLT would be extremely beneficial;
  • Experience with microservices architecture
  • Knowledge of DAPR beneficial.
  • Blazor or Razor ASP.Net beneficial.

 

What we provide:

  • 34 holidays (including bank holidays)
  • 'Work from anywhere in the UK' (as long as you can make morning stand-up) with regular get-togethers in our Edinburgh HQ
  • A Flexible working policy where compressed hours and part time working is considered
  • A competitive salary that reflects your experience and merit
  • Employer Pension contributions
  • An employee referral program
  • Tax beneficial access to HMRC Cyclescheme and Techscheme
  • Professional development and training, including Microsoft certification exams;

 

If you are passionate about technology, have the ability to work on your own initiative, self motivated and willing to learn, we'd love to hear from you.

Please note:  You must be located in the UK and have the right to work in the UK, we are unable to offer visa sponsorship.

results.title: Data Analyst
results.description:
Description

This is a remote position.

Position:          Data Analyst                                         Department:    Solutions – Operations

Reports To:     VP, Operations                                     Date:                November 2022

 

 

 

The Data Analyst is responsible for leveraging data and other resources to identify actionable trends and patterns that support business, technology and operations decision-making. Through a combination of deep domain expertise, expert product knowledge and strong data skills, the Data Analyst will turn data into information, information into insight, and insight into business decisions. The Data Analyst reports to VP, Operations. This is a full-time, exempt, remote position.

Specific Responsibilities:

§  Import, clean, transform, validate or model complex data sets from multiple sources in order to understand and answer business questions surrounding:

o   Data quality

o   Operational improvement opportunities

o   Strategic planning

o   Market insights

o   Customer-facing business queries

o   Usage metrics for organizational utilities

 

§  Identify root causes for problems related to adoption, usage, operations and quality, and identify improvements by pinpointing trends, correlations and patterns in complicated data sets.

§  Design and present data and conclusions in charts, graphs and tables. Maintain ongoing reports.

§  Develop and maintain data quality assurance measures and processes.

§  Build out and automate organization's internal and external reporting and analytics capabilities.

§  Recommend data migration approaches for product upgrades.

§  Develop and implement data collection systems and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and data quality.

§  Design and develop relational databases for collecting data; write Data Definition Language or Data Manipulation Language SQL commands.

 

 

Requirements

Skills:

§  Demonstrated self-starter and creative thinker who can handle a considerable amount of unstructured, real-world data and be comfortable thinking about solving problems using new and novel approaches.

§  Experience using one or more business intelligence software tools (Tableau, Cognos, Business Objects, etc.).

§  Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzing large datasets (SPSS, SAS, Excel, etc.).

§  Knowledge of a querying language such as SQL and the ability to write code without depending on an intermediary, guided interface (drag and drop tool).

§  Ability to identify, analyze and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets and present data in a way that is intuitive to technical as well as nontechnical users.

§  Excellent time management skills and the ability to prioritize a full plate.

§  Ability to work collaboratively and effectively across matrix organizations in a fast-paced, schedule-driven and entrepreneurial environment.

 

Experience:

§  Minimum of 4 years of hands-on experience in a Data Analyst role.

§  2+ years of performing data analysis in support of a product organization.

§  Healthcare experience preferred (payer or revenue cycle management).

 

Education:

§  Bachelor’s degree required; Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management or Statistics disciplines preferred.

 

Certification Requirements:

§  None.

 

 

Benefits

This organization recognizes that its most important asset is its growing team of smart, creative, collaborative, forward-thinking and passionate professionals – and that a comprehensive employee benefits package is an important factor for them in choosing where to work. This organization offers competitive compensation along with an extensive benefits package for all full-time employees, including medical, dental and vision coverage, tuition assistance and a 401k. We offer full-time remote work to all staff from any location and maintain a physical office (with many amenities) in downtown Washington, DC.

 

 

Skills

Skills: Demonstrated self-starter and creative thinker who can handle a considerable amount of unstructured, real-world data and be comfortable thinking about solving problems using new and novel approaches. Ability to identify, analyze and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets and present data in a way that is intuitive to technical as well as nontechnical users. Ability to use critical thinking skills to propose solutions and think strategically. Experience using one or more business intelligence software tools (Tableau, Cognos, Business Objects, etc.) Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzing large datasets (SPSS, SAS, Excel, etc.) Knowledge of a querying language such as SQL and the ability to write code without depending on an intermediary, guided interface (drag and drop tool). Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Must be comfortable with speaking in front of a wide variety of technical and business stakeholder audiences. Basic understanding of software development and relational data models. Ability to work collaboratively and effectively across matrix organizations in a fast-paced, schedule-driven and entrepreneurial environment. Excellent time management skills and the ability to prioritize a full plate. Intermediate to advanced skills with Microsoft Office, Word, Excel, PowerPoint. Experience with Customer Relationship Management platforms such as Salesforce is preferred. Percent of Travel: None. Experience: · Minimum of four years of hands-on experience in a data analyst role. · 2+ years of performing data analysis in support of a product organization. · Healthcare experience preferred (provider data or network management). Education: Bachelor’s degree required; Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management or Statistics disciplines preferred.

results.title: Chief of Staff
results.description:
We’re on a mission to improve health through nutrition. 

At Simple, we are working on improving health through nutrition, because we believe that this is how we can have the biggest impact on the world. Evidence for the links between health behaviors and later disease and ill-health is strong. Effective interventions will enable people to live longer and healthier lives, and Simple is tasked with making this a reality.

Simple is a mobile application that helps people to improve their nutritional habits through various interventions. It combines personalized programs with meal tracking and health insights -- unlocking the path to healthier and happier lives. Launched in 2019, we rapidly grew to a 15M user base and a 100%+ YoY revenue growth. Now moving to a bigger market, we need to find an engineering leader who will help us to build the best product on the market in a rapid-growth company.

We are proud of our people. We believe that the Simple team is the key to our success and the company’s most valuable asset. So, if you are interested in health and wellness, enjoy solving challenging problems, and have always aspired to become part of a global project —  we want to hear from you!

As a Chief of Staff, you will be the CEO’s right-hand person and force multiplier in many instances. Have a significant impact on the efficiency and productivity of the company.

Reporting directly to the CEO. 

Build a healthier world with us!

 

What you’ll do:
  • Be an extension of the CEO;
  • Oversee and manage internal operations: prepare agendas, take notes, and assign action items at weekly meetings; manage the OKR and annual planning processes, support with board meeting prep, manage All Hands meetings;
  • Improves our management system and rolls out changes across the company;
  • Manage CEO’s time allocation closely to ensure it is spent on the top priorities for the company;
  • Partner with Product, Finance, Pricing, and Analytics to prepare analytical and financial reports and metric dashboards;
  • Manage high-priority cross-functional initiatives, ad-hoc support, or longer-term special projects (examples – culture, decision-making frameworks, organizational design);
  • Keep the CEO accountable for commitments while helping keep reports accountable for results;

What we look for:
  • Top management consulting experience or 5+ years of experience at a high-growth tech company preferred;
  • Familiar with current productivity tools (Jira, Asana, Slack, etc);
  • Highly organized, excellent communicator (both written and verbal);
  • Ability to work strategically and collaboratively across departments, as well as an influence at all levels of the organization;
  • Experience with data analysis, budget management, operations management;
  • Proven track record setting up and scaling different processes within a high-growth environment;
  • Strategic thinking, as well as a willingness to lead initiatives through implementation
  • Strong ownership mentality;
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills;
  • Fluency in English;

 

Why you might be excited about us:
  • You will help build a product that improves people’s health & lives through nutrition;
  • You will have a unique perspective across the company. This includes things like joining board meetings, executive staff meetings, and supporting the vision, and strategy setting for the company;
  • Being a chief of staff is a way to accelerate your career growth as you’re shadowing the founder & CEO directly;
  • Incredible insights into the different functions — product, marketing, growth, operations— of a fast-growing tech company and how they all work together;
  • Remote, with occasional business trips (roughly 10% of the time);
  • A competitive salary package based on your unique expertise, skillset, and impact on the business;
  • A stock option plan for every employee. When Simple does well, everyone benefits;
  • Top technical equipment, health insurance, relocation program, friendly and highly qualified colleagues, healthy snacks in our office’s kitchen (if you are in Cyprus, London).

results.title: Chief of Staff
results.description:
Our Mission

We uplift people and economies around the world through entrepreneurship.

To know more about 500 Latin America, click here.

Who We Are

500 Global is a venture capital firm with $2.7B in assets under management that invests in founders building fast-growing technology companies. We focus on markets where technology, innovation, and capital can unlock long-term value and drive economic growth. We work closely with key stakeholders and advise governments and corporations on how best to support entrepreneurial ecosystems so startups can thrive.

500 Global has backed over 5,000 founders representing more than 2,600 companies operating in 81 countries. We have invested in 51 companies valued at over $1 billion and 140+ companies valued at over $100 million (including private, public, and exited companies). Our 140+ plus team members are located in more than 20 countries and bring experience as entrepreneurs, investors, and operators from some of the world’s leading technology companies.

What We Need

The Chief of Staff for 500 Latin America (“CoS”) will be working with the Firm’s Managing Partner based in Latin America to facilitate the execution of strategic priorities, through relationship building, communications, project management, and problem-solving,

This person will serve as the right hand to the Managing Partner for their most important priorities, including the day-to-day operations of various regions, business units, and special projects, working closely with the Product and Portfolio Value teams to help them lead cross-functional projects.

The CoS will act as a strategist, consultant, and implementer, to ensure streamlined activities across Latin America and globally. They will contribute to the long-term success of the Firm by focusing on scaling operational infrastructure, as well as our expansion into new markets and products by seamlessly moving between strategic and tactical roadmaps.

We work at an incredible pace, so this person will need to be a self-starter with excellent EQ, written, verbal, and visual communication skills, strong time management skills, uncanny attention to detail, the ability to work under pressure in a fast-paced environment, and above all, flexibility and discretion. This role may require non-standard working hours across multiple time zones and significant travel.

This position will be remote, although candidates already based in Mexico would be preferred for time zone coverage.

Who You Are

You share our passion for uplifting people and economies around the world through entrepreneurship. You thrive in entrepreneurial, creative, fast-paced environments managing multiple time zones and working with people around the world from different backgrounds and cultures. You have exceptional communication skills, organizational skills, keen attention to detail and a strong ability to manage relationships and projects, start-to-end. You gain energy from managing a wide variety of tasks and can change focus quickly as our industry and business needs change. You bring boundless positivity and energy to any workplace you work in.

What You Will Be Doing

Overall, the role is expected to be fluid and the candidate needs to be flexible, working alongside the shifting needs of the Firm. However, expected duties and responsibilities will include the following:

  • Act as an advisor to the Managing Partner assisting in facilitating effective decision-making and implementation, and working on projects and strategies.
  • Develop, manage and implement successful and consistent operational processes, systems, tools, playbooks, solutions and programs to make functions and projects more effective.
  • Coordinate and project manage the execution of assigned strategic initiatives, with specific responsibility for cross-functional delivery of key projects, ensuring smooth collaboration across multiple geographies and teams, tracking performance and successful completion of short and long-term goals reporting back to the Managing Partner on progress, blockers and risks.
  • Act as the communication arm for the Managing Partner with team members, clients, investors, community members and other stakeholders.
  • Organize and gather information from various departments and meetings on assigned strategic priorities and report that information, along with recommendations, to the Managing Partner.
  • Oversee the research and preparation of decks and briefing materials on strategic priorities or investor relations matters for upcoming meetings and events, draft event briefings and talking points, and support preparation for internal and external events on behalf of the Managing Partner.
  • Handling inquiries and routine or complex responsibilities as delegated.

Requirements

  • Experience in creative problem-solving and eliminating barriers at any organizational level.
  • Superior analytical and project management capabilities. Proven ability in prioritizing workflows, working independently within tight deadlines, and collaborating across teams with limited supervision.
  • Comfortable managing multiple projects across a wide variety of functional business problems.
  • Clear, effective communicator across written and verbal communication; able to influence and collaborate with stakeholders across functions at all levels of experience.
  • Creativity and comfortable with ‘blank sheet of paper’ assignments. Comfortable with ambiguity and identifying what may be needed to define clarity.
  • Discreet and trustworthy in handling sensitive commercial information and conducting discussions accordingly.

Technical Requirements

  • Strongly proficient in Excel / Sheets and Powerpoint / Slides.
  • Familiarity with CRM and database software.

Education & Experience

  • Strong academic track record, with a degree in Law, Business, Economics or Management.
  • 4-6 years of work experience as a Chief of Staff in an international organization, or work experience in either a top-tier strategy consulting firm or in-house strategy team, a high growth technology startup or venture capital firm, or a top-tier legal firm.

This role is accepting candidates based in Mexico. You must have the right to live and work in the country where you are located.

results.title: Senior Software Engineer
results.description:
Haul is a digital hiring platform that connects certified and vetted commercial truck drivers with trucking companies in a flexible and efficient manner. Haul provides drivers the freedom to choose assignments based on type, length, and schedule, while offering visibility to pay and immediate access to earned wages.
 
Simultaneously, Haul meets the needs of third-party logistics, private fleets, and trucking companies to provide drivers in a way that best meets their business needs, from temporary flex workers to full-time hires. Created by Uber Freight alumni, Haul is based in the San Francisco Bay Area and Denver.
 
Our stack:
- Microservices
- NestJS (NodeJS + TypeScript)
- ReactJS + ReactNative
- MongoDB
 
Why this would be an exciting opportunity for you:
- We're a small team - you'll be one of our first engineering hires.
- Your work will move the needle.
- We're not just another software company. We're building solutions to solve real-world problems, creating employment opportunities for one of the most underserved demographics in America.
- You won't be just coding all day. You will be part of operations - understand various aspects of the business. We believe in a well-rounded engineer.
- We have a roadmap to build many industry-first features. The technical challenges are abundant if you're looking for them.
 
Why this might NOT be a good fit for you:
- If you're looking for a first job out of boot camp. Our team is small and we are building a more experienced team to execute. We don't have the luxury of resources at the moment to train someone new to Node.JS or React.
- We're a small team. We don't have everything figured out. Don't expect to have a process for everything you do or are asked to do.
- Things change quickly in startup work. We do our best to plan our work but things can change. If you're not a fan of being flexible and adaptive, this might not be for you.
- Fast-paced, take a risk.
- We won't ask you to write code that lasts forever. We will ask you to architect and build things that can accommodate changes 6-12 months down the road.
- Self-driven / most of the time, you'll be remote. We have an office in the Bay Area but most of our staff are remote.
Benefits & Perks
📈 Stock options and competitive compensation package
🏝 Flexible personal time off
🩺 Health, Dental, and Vision Insurance
🏦 Employer-sponsored 401k
 
For an all-remote position in the rest of the United States, we're putting a lot of thought into building an all-inclusive remote environment. Prioritizing documentation over verbal communication, asynchronous vs. in person.

results.title: DevOps / SRE Engineer
results.description:
DevOps / Site Reliability Engineer / SRE

We’re building a more open society. Want to help?

OpenCorporates is the largest source of open company data in the world with over 200 million companies in our database. We firmly believe delivering genuine corporate transparency benefits both business and society. Our vision to become the world’s foundational and definitive source of company data.

Corporate transparency enables citizens, companies and governments to make clearer choices about who they do business with. It throttles crime, helps protect workers and our environment. It oils the wheels of prosperity, fairness and sustainability.

OpenCorporates was conceived to drive that change. We’ve worked with bodies like the World Bank and the G20 to spearhead initiatives such as the Open Company Data Index and the creation of the Global Legal Entity Identifier Foundation. Our expertise has shaped how the US Federal Government procures services; we have advised the European Commission on the EU Open Data Directive; and we were instrumental in the UK Companies House opening access to their company data.

Our platform dynamically captures and curates the records of over 200 million companies from 140 jurisdictions around the world — openly available information that is the foundation to sourcing, risk, compliance, and investigations processes for organisations around the world — large and small, public and private.

Our four company values outline the shared principles that define our culture and drive our success: we are bold, we are one team, we learn & adapt and we put our users first. Whether through day-to-day decision making, teamwork, supporting our clients or evaluating performance, the values are the lens we look through to help us achieve great things.

OpenCorporates operates an informal hybrid model around our London workspace. Working from home is the norm and in-person touchpoints are expected to become more frequent.

The Role:
We’re looking for a DevOps / SRE Engineer to join OpenCorporates, the world’s largest open database of company info, and one of the most exciting and important data companies in the world. We’re expanding fast, and seeking someone who lives and breathes cloud, who is passionate about open source, and who can cope with a dynamic changing environment.

 

OpenCorporates is revolutionising access to company data, and with it genuinely changing the world for the better. Our data is more trusted, more transparent, fresher and depended upon by everyone from investigative journalists and anti-corruption investigators to law enforcement, major banks and fintech unicorns. We are an innovative, fast growing, scale-up with aggressive goals and a public benefit mission at its core.

 

Desirable skills / experience:

  • Knowledge and understanding of SRE and DevOps processes

  • Ability to create and set SLI/SLOs/Dashboards using Grafana/Kibana

  • Experience of AWS (Understanding of the well architected framework, core services like IAM, EKS, S3, RDS, Opensearch)

  • Knowledge of Terraform (building modules and complex deployments)

  • Knowledge and understanding of security, DevSecOps and governance (including tools and services like Guardduty, Cloudtrail, Checkov, Renovatabot

  • Command line Linux experience

  • Knowledge and experience of scripting languages (Ideally Bash, Python)

  • Knowledge of networking (AWS VPN, Routing, Watchguards)

Benefits

 

• Competitive salary • Share options scheme

• Flexible hours • Remote-first working

• 28 days holiday plus bank hols • 1 day additional holiday each year

• Time off for life events • £500 home office budget

• Cycle to work scheme • Quarterly in-person meetings and socials

• Wellbeing Pledge • Life assurance

• £1000 learning and wellness allowance, plus learning days



Diversity Matters

Don’t meet every single requirement? At OpenCorporates we are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive and authentic workplace, so if you’re excited about this role but your past experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply regardless. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles.
